newsitem.title: JAPAN: Prosecutors say Yamaichi Sec suspected of payoff.
newsitem.headline: Prosecutors say Yamaichi Sec suspected of payoff.

text.p: Tokyo prosecutors said on Wednesday they suspected Yamaichi Securities Co Ltd paid 79 million yen to a "sokaiya" corporate racketeer.
They told a news conference that 200 investigators, including 50 from the securities watchdog, the Securities and Exchange Surveillance Commission, were raiding 10 offices of Yamaichi on Wednesday.
A Yamaichi spokesman said about 100 investigators went into its headquarters around 9 a.m. (0000 GMT).
"About 100 people came, and we think that it is a joint team of prosecutors and the SESC (Securities and Exchange Surveillance Commission)," the spokesman said without elaborating.
